page.title: 20CRANOE
page.content: { Cranoe}is a hamlet of 11 houses and 32 people. The two farmhouses are not in our block. In the nine houses which are, the post office is run by two elderly ladies (the only ones without their own transport); there is a retired farmer, a widow and six other householders who commute. The post office is a small centre of community life, as is the church: there is a service every fortnight and an average of five people attending. All the village join together for church fund raising. Since the school closed 16 years ago, and the pub closed by teetotal landlords, there is no place for meetings: so Cranoe Grange is used for the annual parish and PCC meetings, which everyone attends. -------------------------------------- Author: {Gill Evans Computer input: {Jonathan Evans
